description: This contemporary public affairs course examines normative commitments and empirical evidence relevant to the workings of government, markets, and society as applied to contemporary issues. Possible topics include immigration, abortion, education, sexuality, medical care, foreign policy, income inequality and poverty, affirmative action, and responses to climate change. Offered annually in the spring semester. Prerequisite: PACON 180.
name: Contemporary Controversies
notes: Open only to Public Affairs Conversation students.
title: Public Affairs II: Contemporary Controversies
